ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 22
ygData.msgSnippet: That is cool! I ll be there. Trying to decide what type of character I want to make there now :) Zoya, Rodcet Nife
ygData.messageBody:
That is cool! I'll be there. Trying to decide what type of character I want
to make there now :)

Zoya, Rodcet Nife
----------
>From: Suzanne Johnson <katannah@...>
>To: EQ_women@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Digest Number 22
>Date: Sat, Jul 10, 1999, 11:36 AM
>

>From: Suzanne Johnson <katannah@...>
>
>Okay, how about this? August 6th, on the Quellios server, in the Freeport Arena?
>Starting time, say 7 PM PST (that's 10 PM for you East coasties, if that's too
>late for a Friday night, just let me know and we can negotiate. <grins>)? I'll
>make a character and let you know what your "hostess's" name is...... =P
>
>Sara, Povar
>
>Obrien wrote:
>
>> From: "Obrien" <obrien@...>
>>
>> Hi All..
>>
>> I also like the idea of us all grouping up and hunting together.. where and
>> when.. hope i can make it..
>>
>> See u in their world
>>
>> Catt/Reba
>> E'ci

>> > Message: 1
>> > Date: Wed, 07 Jul 1999 09:03:09 -0400
>> > From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>
>> > Subject: Hello!
>> >
>> > New subscription to the list here.
>> >
>> > I don't know what's usual for an introduction, but here goes:
>> >
>> > I'm an (alost) middle-aged computer person/working mom. I've been RPGing
>> > since I was 11 years old (started in pre D&D era), and since D&D, AD&D,
>> > Traveller, ICE, GURPS etc ... all came out when I was in high school to
>> > college I pen & paper RPed/GMed/DMed a lot back then. I ran an all-female
>> > group around 20 years ago in my college hometown which at one time
>> included
>> > my then 80-90-year-old (passed away now) conservative German immigrant
>> > grandmother. She would visit and I really got to ask "Canasta or D&D?".
>> :)
>> > I also ran mixed and male-only (except for me) groups.
>> >
>> > Due to time contraints of job and children I haven't done pencil & paper
>> > games for at well over a decade, but do play on-line! I've played other
>> > on-line RPGs (but not UO for more than 1 week) for years, and am now
>> > playing in EQ. Since I never have enough time ... my characters "never
>> > amount to much". But I have fun! My almost teen daughter has played
>> > on-line with me in two other RPGs (supervised), and helps with the EQ
>> > character creation. If I can ever get ADSL here, we'll be a mother &
>> > daughter team on-line. :) Sometimes I think we have as much fun coming up
>> > with the ideas for a character as actually playing them.
>> >
>> > I like to experiment with character ideas and right now have no "main"
>> > character. So far I like Enchanter & Bard. Though my Necromancer is
>> > surprisingly fun to play. I sort of enjoy the amazement (do they even
>> > belive me?) when I claim that it REALLY is a female player behind this
>> > female character. I know thay don't belive me when I tell many of the
>> > college age males that I've been playing/running RPGs longer than they've
>> > been alive (and I'm female). ;) I mainly play on Erollisi Marr, but
>> > occasionally play on the Test Server.
>> >
>> > - Lora
>> >
>> > P.S.
>> > My husband tolerates us well (he's not an RPGer), and I'm waiting to see
>> if
>> > my son got "the gene".
>> >
>> > At the moment:
>> > Starling, Lisonja, Ainsley, Meute, Mitte, Shaelie & Leontine
>> > on Erollisi Marr
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> ____________________________________________________________________________
>> ___
>> >
>> ____________________________________________________________________________
>> ___
>> >

>> > Message: 4
>> > Date: Wed, 7 Jul 1999 09:06:38 -0500
>> > From: "MJ Solomon" <mjsol@...>
>> > Subject: Re: happenings
>> >
>> > I know I've accidently dropped something...my back pack... and then it was
>> gone, and that was really all there was to it. Tough luck for me. The way I
>> accidently dropped something was having all my slots full as I was looting
>> my corpse and mistakenly trying to pick up something else with a right
>> click. I shouted and ooced a bit asking if anyone had seen my backpack with
>> my newbie club in it, but there was no answer. Forget it. Tough pattoooties
>> on me.
>> > -----Original Message-----
>> > From: Page Kennon <pickone@...>
>> > To: EQ_women@onelist.com <EQ_women@onelist.com>
>> > Date: Wednesday, July 07, 1999 4:06 AM
>> > Subject: [EQ_women] happenings
>> >
>> >
>> > Hi everyone,
>> > I have a question for You all, i dont know if anyone else has
>> experianced this but well here goes. I wont go in to which server and what
>> characters but on the server that i play on a friend of mine was accused of
>> stealing from another player, they say they didnt see the other person in
>> the room and the other party involved swears on them sitting on top of this
>> item for some reason they have dropped in the floor. Now for the reasons
>> this was in the floor i still dont understand. Now this is me but if
>> something is laying there its open for the taking people drop unwanted stuff
>> all the time. I wont go into all the deltails but there was a big todo
>> about it and i was trying to talk my friend into giving it back and had them
>> talked into it when the other party in question and their friends started
>> threating. Ok now this makes me angery be cause they threaten them with
>> having a GM friend delete their character. By this point i am angery one
>> because i do what ever i can to help people, so i let them know how stupid i
>> though this whole matter was to try to get someone deleted.... this lovely
>> female if she was inturn desided she wanted to call me a bitch while all
>> along i am trying to get her her things back in which i did. Now i will
>> take alot but that was something that was uncalled for me knowing if all of
>> them had just kept their mouths shut i could have gotten the stuff back with
>> out any furth happenings other than what had gone on before i logged on.
>> Has this happened to anyone else or is my server just full of rude Arse
>> people?
>> >
>> > Page :o)
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >

>> > Message: 6
>> > Date: Wed, 7 Jul 1999 10:40:39 -0400 (EDT)
>> > From: truffle@...
>> > Subject: Re: happenings
>> >
>> >
>> > I've had people who have yelled at me when I was trying to help them as
>> well. I think their are a lot of reasons why this kind of thing happens:
>> >
>> > Many people are instinctively untrusting of other players because they
>> expect them to kill steal, cheat, lie, and do anything they can to get more
>> XP/loot.
>> >
>> > Many people don't feel that the social rules of normal society apply to
>> online society, especially when they are playing a character. They feel
>> disassociated from social responsibility because it's all not real.
>> >
>> > All you can do in this situation is state factually "I'm trying to help
>> you, whether you believe it or not". If they're still abusive, they're
>> really not worth helping! It sounds to me like your approach was quite
>> reasonable.
>> >
>> > My own recent abusive story was as follows. I was fighting an aviak
>> avocet in south karana, and I had to leave the zone, so I shouted 'avocet to
>> lake rathe zone'. On the way out, the avocet got distracted and jumped on
>> two people fighting a rook. I turned around, went into hand to hand combat
>> to get the avocet off of them (taking massive damage in the process). I
>> then ran the avocet away, doubled back, and bolted their rook to death
>> because I knew, after the avocet was on them, they'd probably be too weak to
>> finish this. After the fact, they accused me of trying to train the avocet
>> onto them, and then trying to STEAL THEIR ROOK KILL (which I didn't). What
>> really annoyed me was one of these people was someone I'd had a pleasent
>> conversation or two with in the past. Luckily, most people in that zone
>> know I'm a nice person (probably because I have a general policy of helping
>> out anyone I see in hand to hand with an aviak, and I heal people who are
>> badly hurt while fighting!
>> > ). So, when they started yelling in OOC about what they thought I was
>> doing, people believed me when I explained what had really happened.
>> >
>> > On a last and completely unrelated note, I must admit with some
>> embarassment that I accepted an expensive gift from a higher level druid
>> last night. He gave me mamoth leggings and...I just couldn't turn them
>> down. One rule I have which makes something like that much easier to bare,
>> is that I will never sell any gift I'm given. Instead, I will try and give
>> it to some worthy newbie (by worthy I mean untwinked and capable of role
>> play). So, when I get those gator scale leggings, some druid newbie is
>> going to get a nice surprise.
>> >
>> > - Christina
>> >
>> > > Hi everyone,
>> > >
>> > > I have a question for You all, i dont know if anyone else has
>> > > experianced this but well here goes. I wont go in to which server and
>> > > what characters but on the server that i play on a friend of mine was
>> > > accused of stealing from another player, they say they didnt see the
>> > > other person in the room and the other party involved swears on them
>> > > sitting on top of this item for some reason they have dropped in the
>> > > floor. Now for the reasons this was in the floor i still dont
>> > > understand. Now this is me but if something is laying there its open
>> > > for the taking people drop unwanted stuff all the time. I wont go into
>> > > all the deltails but there was a big todo about it and i was trying to
>> > > talk my friend into giving it back and had them talked into it when the
>> > > other party in question and their friends started threating. Ok now
>> > > this makes me angery be cause they threaten them with having a GM friend

>> > > ever i can to help people, so i let them know how stupid i though this
>> > > whole matter was to try to get someone deleted.... this lovely female if
>> > > she was inturn desided she wanted to call me a bitch while all along i
>> > > am trying to get her her things back in which i did. Now i will take
>> > > alot but that was something that was uncalled for me knowing if all of
>> > > them had just kept their mouths shut i could have gotten the stuff back
>> > > with out any furth happenings other than what had gone on before i
>> > > logged on. Has this happened to anyone else or is my server just full

>> > Message: 7
>> > Date: Wed, 7 Jul 1999 10:49:36 -0400 (EDT)
>> > From: truffle@...
>> > Subject: Re: Hello!
>> >
>> >
>> > Hey Lora!
>> >
>> > I think many of us have played pen-and-paper RPGs. I've also played RPGs
>> since I was 11 (starting with the original Basic D&D). I actually ran an
>> RPG zine for a while, and wrote a module for Dungeon magazine. I've also
>> reviewed TSR/GURPS material prior to publication (translation: I knew a guy
>> who wrote for them, and I reviewed his manuscripts). At one time I
>> seriously considered becoming a full time RPG writer, but then I saw my
>> friend who did it full time still lived with his parents, and I decided to
>> be a computer programmer instead 8)
>> >
>> > My favorite pen and paper RPG is without a doubt Ars Magica. I can't
>> figure out why it hasn't become the most popular RPG ever actully. The
>> thing I like the most about it is its magic system, which ... well I won't
>> go into the whole thing but it's super cool. Wait, here is a link which
>> describes it, so you can read about it if you want.
>> >
>> > http://azathoth.gg.caltech.edu/troupe/ars/magic.html
>> >
>> > What I really like about this system is that it is a two dimensional
>> system. In Everquest, for example, a spell is an 'Evocation' spell (and you
>> have an evocation skill). In Ars Magica, if you wanted to throw fireballs
>> around you'd have to train up 'Creo' (create) and 'Ignem' (fire). But, as a
>> side benefit, you'd also be better at extinguishing fire, and creating
>> water. This makes for interesting and complex magical dynamics.
>> >
>> > - Christina
>> >
>> > ---- you wrote:
>> > > From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>
>> > >
>> > > I'm an (alost) middle-aged computer person/working mom. I've been
>> RPGing
>> > > since I was 11 years old (started in pre D&D era), and since D&D, AD&D,
>> >
>> > ---------------------------------------------------
>> > Get free personalized email at http://www.iname.com
>> >
>> >
>> >

>> ___
>> >
>> ____________________________________________________________________________
>> ___

>> > Message: 8
>> > Date: Wed, 07 Jul 1999 10:54:48 -0700
>> > From: Page Kennon <pickone@...>
>> > Subject: Re: happenings
>> >
>> > Glad to know i am not the only one who has been through it *the person
>> causing the stink was twinked to btw* Anyway i have to say i dont sell
>> gifts either i pass them along to my needed guild members and with my wizard
>> i have never been so lucky but i started a paladin bout a week ago and
>> someone came up and ask me how they spoke with the shopkeep to sell, and i
>> told them *they had been away for a long while* as i turned to leave they
>> gave me all their armor and gold, i was floored when He started giving me
>> the armor i told Him there was no way i could give him anything in return
>> for the fact was i had nothing. Just the other day i had a person come up
>> out of no where and give me a mino axe after asking me what weapon i was
>> using. I have never been so lucky with one character :o)
>> >
>> > truffle@... wrote:
>> >
>> > > From: truffle@...
>> > >
>> > > I've had people who have yelled at me when I was trying to help them as
>> well. I think their are a lot of reasons why this kind of thing happens:
>> > >
>> > > Many people are instinctively untrusting of other players because they
>> expect them to kill steal, cheat, lie, and do anything they can to get more
>> XP/loot.
>> > >
>> > > Many people don't feel that the social rules of normal society apply to

>> > - You spy the newspaper open to the personal ads and instead of wondering

>> > your spouse is reading them you wonder why there are so many single
>> DWarFs.
>> > -You answer the phone with "Heyo" instead of "Hello".
>> > -Go see a shrink because no one is TELLING you anything!
>> > -You see a stray cat and you start thinking about making a new pair of
>> > gloves.
>> > -You have to fight the urge to /CON the bagboy at the grocery store before
>> > killing him and looting his remains.
>> > -You put on jewelry before going to the grocery store thinking it will
>> raise
>> > your charisma and get you a better price.
>> > -When packing for a move you find that...
>> > you combine some duct tape and some duct tape only to find that you
>> lack
>> > the skill.
>> > you check your WeighT before lifting the box
>> > -When the book you are working on suddenly sprouts the word "say" before
>> > every quotation.
>> > -When you call the kids next door "Orcs"
>> > -When you need to go to the grocery store and ask you significant
>> > other/friend to join your hunting party
>> > -When you always type ' or " before everything you say in the chat room.
>> > -When you always write ' or " at the beginning of the notes you write to
>> > remind yourself to eat and sleep
>> > -When you find yourself /CONSIDERing everyone you meet.
>> > -When you say /WHO FRIENDS ALL while watching TV
>> > -When you forgot what the TV was for in the first place
>> > -If you've ever actually said OOC in real life
>> > -If you haven't realized it
>> > -If you've ever snuggled and smooched a near-total stranger
>> > -If hearing "GM" causes your body to reflexively bow
>> > -If your kids announce to you they are going to forage for their own
>> dinner
>> > -If, when socializing with friends, you:
>> > Say "chuckle" and "grin"
>> > Poke them in the ribs and tickle them way too much for their comfort.
>> > -You answer to your name with an "Aye?"
>> > -When going out for your nightly jog, you ask your neighbor for an SoW.
>> > - When you tell your spouse that you don't have enough plat to order
>> pizza.
>> > - When you forget to turn on the hallway light and start looking for your
>> > lightstone
>> > - When you see a group of kids on the street corner and wonder if they are
>> > aggressive.
>> > - When you see a spider on the wall and thank the gods it isn't a dune
>> > tarantula.
>> > - When you go to church and think "I've seen prettier temples."
>> > - When you pick up your hammer and wonder what the speed and damage is.
>> > - When you get stuck in traffic and think about petitioning for a GM.
>> > - When you are done for the day at work and wish you had gate.

>> > >
>> > >Hey Lora!
>> > >
>> > >I think many of us have played pen-and-paper RPGs. I've also played RPGs
>> > >since I was 11 (starting with the original Basic D&D). I actually ran an
>> > >RPG zine for a while, and wrote a module for Dungeon magazine. I've also
>> > >reviewed TSR/GURPS material prior to publication (translation: I knew a
>> guy
>> > >who wrote for them, and I reviewed his manuscripts). At one time I
>> > >seriously considered becoming a full time RPG writer, but then I saw my
>> > >friend who did it full time still lived with his parents, and I decided
>> to
>> > >be a computer programmer instead 8)
>> > >
>> > >My favorite pen and paper RPG is without a doubt Ars Magica. I can't
>> > >figure out why it hasn't become the most popular RPG ever actully. The
>> > >thing I like the most about it is its magic system, which ... well I
>> won't
>> > >go into the whole thing but it's super cool. Wait, here is a link which
>> > >describes it, so you can read about it if you want.
>> > >
>> > >http://azathoth.gg.caltech.edu/troupe/ars/magic.html
>> > >
>> > >What I really like about this system is that it is a two dimensional
>> > >system. In Everquest, for example, a spell is an 'Evocation' spell (and
>> > >you have an evocation skill). In Ars Magica, if you wanted to throw
>> > >fireballs around you'd have to train up 'Creo' (create) and 'Ignem'
>> (fire).
>> > > But, as a side benefit, you'd also be better at extinguishing fire, and
>> > >creating water. This makes for interesting and complex magical dynamics.
>> > >
>> > >- Christina
>> > >
>> > > ---- you wrote:
>> > > > From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>
>> > > >

>> > > > since I was 11 years old (started in pre D&D era), and since D&D,
